medical_history.chief_complaint: Lower left quadrant abdominal pain with subjective fevers and constipation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced a constant, slowly progressive lower abdominal pain (L>R) 5 days prior to admission. Three days ago, chills and intense diaphoresis occurred, although no objective fevers were reported. Nausea has been present without vomiting, and a poor appetite alongside constipation has been noted, with flatus passed. The patient has experienced weight loss over the past 6 months related to stress at work.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with hypertension. Father died of heart problems.
